meanings.sent1: I found a tick on my dog after our walk in the woods.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check for ticks after spending time outdoors.
meanings.sent3: The tick on the dog was so tiny, it almost looked like a speck of dirt.
meanings.sent4: The tick held on tightly to the skin, like a tiny vampire feeding on blood.
meanings.sent5: The thought of a tick crawling on me gives me the shivers.

meanings.definition: A mark indicating correctness or completion
meanings.sent1: She put a tick next to each completed task on her list.
meanings.sent2: The teacher placed a tick on the paper to show the correct answer.
meanings.sent3: Seeing a tick next to my name made me feel accomplished.
meanings.sent4: The tick on the paper was like a little reward for getting it right.
meanings.sent5: Each tick on the list brought a sense of satisfaction.

meanings.sent1: The clock made a soft tick every second.
meanings.sent2: The tick of the metronome kept the musicians in time.
meanings.sent3: The tick of the clock was the only sound in the silent room.
meanings.sent4: The constant tick of the clock became a comforting background noise.
meanings.sent5: The tick of the clock echoed through the empty house.

meanings.definition: A sudden, brief moment or instance
meanings.sent1: In a tick, the squirrel darted across the path and disappeared into the bushes.
meanings.sent2: With a tick of the clock, the new year began.
meanings.sent3: The tick of time marked the end of one chapter and the start of another.
meanings.sent4: In the brief tick of a moment, everything changed.
meanings.sent5: Life can change in a single tick of the clock.
